DOC.HEAD: Former Bakker Associates Make Court Appearances in PTL Case
LaserPhoto CH2
DOC.TEXT: Two former Jim Bakker associates accused of lying to a grand jury have been released on $25,000 bond pending their trials. Evangelist John Wesley Fletcher, whose introduction of Jessica Hahn to Bakker led to the scandal that destroyed the television ministry, and the Rev. Sam Johnson, former pastor of the Heritage Church at PTL, were both released following a brief hearing Wednesday. Fletcher is accused of lying to a grand jury about why he introduced Ms. Hahn to Bakker in 1980, and Johnson is accused of lying to the same grand jury about the source of a $10,000 loan he made to one of Bakker's aides that eventually was given to Ms. Hahn. Johnson's arraignment was scheduled for Jan. 16. Fletcher appeared without an attorney before U.S. Magistrate Paul Taylor, who imposed several conditions for his release, including surrendering his passport and refraining from the use of alcohol and narcotics. Fletcher recently was arrested twice in one night in Durham on charges of driving while impaired. ``My life has been in such shambles these past three years,'' Fletcher said as he left the federal courthouse in downtown Charlotte. Taylor said he would appoint counsel for Fletcher after the evangelist told the magistrate: ``I have nothing, sir, except the clothes on my back.'' Taylor did not schedule Fletcher's arraignment because he said it will take about a week to appoint counsel. Johnson faces five years in prison and a $250,000 fine for each of 12 perjury counts. Fletcher could face the same sentence on one perjury count.
